str2: Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To put, place upon, lay on; I add, give in addition. From epi and tithemi; to impose.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular

str2: On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
The tongue; by implication, a language.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From prophetes; to foretell events, divine, speak under inspiration, exercise the prophetic office.
